participants: cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify

messages.message: On a more holistic note for non-tech people should we create a slack channel to describe a bug we are seeing so we don’t flood discuss-engineering with this type of chat
yup or the channel is Jira
unless you want immediate support? perhaps the support team can help?

Well it might need a medium for discussion because I may actually just be doing something wrong (imagine a team of like 20 sales people), IMO it would be easier to filter the noise on the spot via the channel and see if it needs jira tickets or if the Sales team/non-tech teams will know what JIRA even is
You could make a jira for tracking and then link it in here when you think it might be operator error/quick fix/urgent

messages.sender: cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify
messages.message: if you have a hunch as to which team it belongs to (eg this is probably a plex because it’s the platform UI), i think it’s probably fine to drop the ticket in #team-whatever as well

messages.sender: cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify
messages.message: that’s on us though to make it clearer what specific domains the engineering teams own if it’s not clear
When you don’t know you could go to support too, like Lydia suggested.

messages.sender: cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify
messages.message: and in general, my bias is to move to a system where a team of 20 sales people would take issues to support/product, who then triages and files a ticket which goes to eng

That makes sense, I think we need to figure out the right step function of it goes to Support who figure out if its a bug or new feature request, if it is a new feature it goes to Product to do its magic (maybe) @Jesika Haria @Justin

> (imagine a team of like 20 sales people)

Alternately, imagine _customers_ trying to do this
who don’t have access to engineers
Yeah, our answer to customers is much simpler: open a Zendesk ticket via support.instabase.com (http://support.instabase.com) or <mailto:support@instabase.com|support@instabase.com> :smile:
what’s the best default place to open tickets if people don’t know who owns the thing they’re opening a ticket up about?

Few things from my support point of view:

1. Folks can :100:  always go to <#CGMBQ0R8E|> to ask any question at all, including "is this a bug?/where do I do a thing?/how do I look through Jira to find out if this has been reported before?/etc..". Support shouldn't be a gatekeeper for reporting a bug, but a place to help _you_ do it if you need a hand.
2. What @paul mentioned there, product feedback, IMO should be the place where "not sure where this goes but it's like a bug or something wonky for sure" should go. Not sure if there is a process or group that is monitoring it, though.
